remote_focus_h.tCintro_Txt1: This page provides the tools to focus the Axis product remotely from the product web page.
remote_focus_h.tCintro_Txt2: An auto focus function is available under the Basic tab. At the bottom of the preview is a pixel counter which is useful in situations where there is a requirement that the image is a certain size, for example face recognition. Under the Advanced tab fine-tune the focus.
remote_focus_h.intro_Txt1: This page provides the tools to focus the Axis product remotely from the product web page.
remote_focus_h.intro_Txt2: An auto focus function is available under the Basic tab. At the bottom of the preview is a pixel counter which is useful in situations where there is a requirement that the image is a certain size, for example face recognition.
remote_focus_h.intro_Txt3: Under the Advanced tab fine-tune the focus or run a full range scan to find the optimal focus setting.
remote_focus_h.intro_NofullScan_Txt: Under the Advanced tab fine-tune the focus to find the optimal focus setting.
remote_focus_h.intro_Txt4: Note: Fine-tune focus automatically and Full range focus scan work best if there is no movement in front of the camera.
remote_focus_h.intro_autoFineTune_Txt: Note: Fine-tune focus automatically works best if there is no movement in front of the camera.
remote_focus_h.intro_Txt5: To perform a simple auto focus follow the instructions under the Basic tab. Use the Zoom slide bar to zoom in on a desired area to focus. If further adjustments are required go to the Advanced tab.
remote_focus_h.intro_Txt6: Note: If the Zoom button is clicked after focusing, you will need to focus again.
remote_focus_h.basic_assist_Txt1: For best results when focusing the
remote_focus_h.basic_assist_Txt2: follow the instructions in the Installation Guide. The iris should be open while the device is being focused, click Open iris, if the button is inactive the iris is already open. When satisfied with the result, click Enable iris.
remote_focus_h.pixelCounter_Txt: Pixel counter - The pixel counter is useful in situations where there is a requirement that the image is a certain size, for example face recognition. To set the size of the rectangle enter the number of pixels to show and click Apply. Check Show pixel counter to enable the box in the image.
remote_focus_h.adv_Txt: Under the Advanced tab are more tools to help achieve the optimal focus position. Before focusing always open the iris and enable it when finished. Position the Focus window in the desired area of the preview.
remote_focus_h.adv2_Txt: Use the Zoom slide bar to zoom in on a desired area to focus.
remote_focus_h.tCadv_Txt: It is recommended to try the Perform auto focus button first, if you're not satisfied with the results, try fine-tuning the focus by clicking in the Focus position bar.
remote_focus_h.adv3_Txt: It is recommended to try the Fine-tune focus automatically button first, if you're not satisfied with the results, try fine-tuning the focus by clicking in the Focus position bar. A third option is to run the Full range focus scan.
remote_focus_h.adv3_Txt-1: It is recommended to try the Fine-tune focus automatically button first, if you're not satisfied with the results, try fine-tuning the focus by clicking in the Focus position bar.
remote_focus_h.fullFocus_scan_Txt: Another option is to run the Full range focus scan.
remote_focus_h.openIris_Txt: Open iris - Use this button to open the iris to its maximum before focusing. When the iris is open to the maximum position it gives the smallest depth of field and provides the best conditions for focusing.
remote_focus_h.adv_reset_Txt: Reset - If the focus has been set before, click this button to reset the back focus to the default position. Follow the instructions in the Installation Guide to adjust the front lens focus first and then proceed with the instructions on the Focus page.
remote_focus_h.tCadv4_Txt: Focus position bar - Click on the bar to put the focus in a desired location. The buttons < and > move the focus position one step in either direction. The buttons << and >> move the focus position in multiple steps in either direction.
remote_focus_h.adv4_Txt1: Fine-tune focus automatically - Try this tool first to automatically set the focus. The focus can be further adjusted by clicking in the Focus position bar.
remote_focus_h.perAutoFocus_Txt: Perform auto focus - Click to focus the camera automatically.
remote_focus_h.adv4_Txt2: Full range focus scan - Transforms the Focus position bar into a graph which shows the optimal focus position. For best results let the scan run to completion, which could take several minutes. The peaks in the graph correspond to the positions that put parts of the scene in focus. Click in the graph to adjust the focus to the desired part of the scene.
remote_focus_h.adv4_Txt3: A Full range scan can be aborted by clicking in the graph.
remote_focus_h.adv4_Txt4: Focus position bar - Click on the bar to put the focus in a desired location. The buttons < and > move the focus position one step in either direction. The buttons << and >> move the focus position in multiple steps in either direction.
remote_focus_h.dayNight_Txt: At day/night switch - For a fixed focus position at all times select Fixed position from the drop-down list. Select Reposition to change the focus settings between two saved positions; one for day and another for night.
remote_focus_h.enableIris_Txt: Enable iris - When satisfied with the focus position enable the iris with this button.
remote_focus_h.irisnote_Txt: Note: The iris should be enabled at all times, except while focusing.
